speaker: COMMANDING OFFICER
line: As soon as we're in position, we'll be on a count of five.

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Excuse me, that's my house.

speaker: MILITARY POLICE OFFICER
line: Ok, let her through.

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: What's going on?

speaker: COMMANDING OFFICER
line: Standby. Mrs. Budahas?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Yeah.

speaker: COMMANDING OFFICER
line: Your husband has violated basic security procedure. He's commandeered a military vehicle that's believed to be armed.

speaker: LEAD OFFICER
line: Keep on moving in.

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Oh God!

speaker: VOICE
line: We have access..

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: You've got to let me talk to him.

speaker: LEAD OFFICER
line: What the hell. We got him but he's gonna need a doctor.. or something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi. I got your message.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sorry for the run around. Can I buy you a drink?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's two-o-clock in the afternoon Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's not stopping the rest of these people. I got something to show you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Something you couldn't show me at work.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's get a table. That's Colonel Robert Budahas. That photo was taken last year when he was a test pilot for the military, stationed at Ellens Air Base in Southwest Idaho. Four months ago, Colonel Budahas experienced a psychotic episode and barricaded himself in his home. Military police were called in. Budahas was removed and apparently hospitalised with treatment of his condition.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which was what, exactly?

speaker: MULDER
line: The military will not comment on the cause, nature or status. In fact, the military will not comment on Colonel Budahas at all.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Budahas has neither seen nor heard from her husband in over four months. Her inquiries to the military have gone unanswered. Last month, she contacted the FBI and reported it as a kidnapping.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What reason would the military have to kidnap one of their own pilots?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's the sixty-four thousand dollar question, Scully. Since 1963, six pilots have been listed as missing in action, from Ellens Air Base. The military will say only that these pilots accepted the risks of flying experimental aircraft.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, there were rumours those pilots were shot down at high altitudes, while they were routinely penetrating Russian air space.

speaker: MULDER
line: There were other rumours too. I've been tracking this case since it came through the Boise regional office last month. Last week, for reasons I can't figure out, it was deprioritised. They shelved this case without an investigation, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So?

speaker: MULDER
line: So, you and I, are going to the spud state to investigate a little kidnapping.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't get it Mulder. Does this have something to do with an X-File? I thought you only liked those, er, paranormal type cases. Am I missing something here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's just say, this case has a, distinct smell to it, a certain, paranormal bouquet. Excuse me.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Leave this case alone Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: The military will not tolerate an FBI investigation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are you?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: I, er, can be of help to you. I've had a certain interest in your work.

speaker: VOICE
line: Sorry.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know about my work?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Well, let's just say that I'm in a position to know quite alot of things, er, things about our government.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are you? Who do you work for?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: It's unimportant, I came here to give you some valuable advice. You are exposing yourself and Agent Scully to unnecessary risk, I advise you to drop the case.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't do that.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: You have much work to do Agent Mulder, don't jeopardise the future of your own efforts.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You ok Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I'm fine.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I checked on that file you gave me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh-huh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You failed to tell me a few things. This isn't some UFO goose chase, you're leading me on, is it? Are you there Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you hear what I said, because the bureau has it out for us already and it would make us appear pretty stupid if my field report, read like some tabloid story.

speaker: MULDER
line: Er, listen, I don't want to talk about it on this line. I'll, I'll talk to you about it, on the flight out, OK?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Budahas?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're from the FBI.

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Oh, yes, please, come in. I started noticing it about two years ago, m, Bob developed this rash under his arms. We'd been doing some renovations on the house, so that, we thought it was a reaction to the paint stripper. But then everything just, went crazy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you mean?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Bob's whole personality, it was so unpredictable. He started, doing things.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kinds of things?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: It was kind of embarassing at first, we were having this dinner party once, and, erm, he sprinkled tetra-meal D all other his food. That's fishfood flakes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you ever talk to him about this?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: I tried, i, it was extemely difficult, Bob would get so angry, he'd, yell at the kids for no reason, and, and then, and then he would shake, like he was having a, a seizure.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did he ever talk about his work?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: It was never discussed, e, even before the problems. Oh, I knew that he worked on top secret projects, word gets around, but, Bob was always a patriot first. He took, loyalty to his country as an oath, and, and now they treat us like strangers. I just want my husband back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know that the government is not above the law. They cannot withhold information.

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Th, then I think, what if he's... How would I support the family?

speaker: MULDER
line: Eeh, you said word gets around, I'm sorry, erm, have you ever heard of this, happening to anyone else?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Erm, yeah. Verla McLennen's husband, he went kinda crazy, but it's, it's not like he didn't get to come home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How long has he been...

speaker: VERLA MCLENNEN
line: Almost two years, the flyfishing idea was his brother Hank's. I was upset at first, but when you're the wife of a test pilot, you thank God just to have him home alive.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. McLennen, has anyone ever offered to explain what caused this?

speaker: VERLA MCLENNEN
line: Stress, I guess. You have to understand, the military deals with things in a certain way. They've given him plenty of therapy, and treatment, and I'm grateful for that. They've taken good care of us. And you know they do volunteer for their jobs. Really Anita, bringing the FBI to my house.

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Here, I've, erm, I've called all the numbers about a thousand times, please, let me know what you find out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We'll be staying at the Beech Grove Motel if you anything, ok?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Thanks. C'mon kids.

speaker: MULDER
line: So what did you make of Uncle Fester down the block?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mmm, it's called sterioptathy, it's a syndrome produced by extreme stress. POWs have been known to suffer from it, they've studied it in zoo animals.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but these guys aren't zoo animals, they're test pilots. They're not supposed to fold under pressure, they're supposed to thrive on it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ever hear of something called The Aurora Project?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, that's the, er, unacknowledged codename for some new kind of defence department, surveillance project.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The Pentagon has all but admitted, they've been testing a secret class of sub-orbital spy craft over the western US. Maybe, these guys are flying those planes. Maybe, these guys are the washouts.

speaker: MULDER
line: You saw the photos on the wall in there. This guy Budahas received a presidential commodation, he's never washed out of anything in his life.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been on hold with the base director of communications for fourty-five minutes, how about you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, somebody named Colonel Kissel will meet with us, a week from Friday.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, right. Did you say Kissel?

speaker: MULDER
line: Colonel Kissel?

speaker: COLONEL KISSEL
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can I talk with you? Special Agent Mulder, FBI.

speaker: COLONEL KISSEL
line: I've got nothing to say. Please, this is an invasion of my privacy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don't you talk to us about Colonel Budahas?

speaker: COLONEL KISSEL
line: Why don't you get the hell out of my yard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good thing we still kept that appointment.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: Hi. Are you the FBI agents? I'm Paul Mossinger, I, er, work for the local paper. We live a few houses down from Verla McLennen, she said you guys are out here looking into this Budahas thing.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're just looking around.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: Aah, gotcha, right. Lot of people around here just looking around, UFO nuts mostly, but it's not everyday we get FBI. By the time you hear them, they're already gone. So this Budahas thing, are you getting anywhere?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're not at liberty to comment.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: Well...

speaker: MULDER
line: Paul? Right? You've lived in this area a while, you ever seen a UFO?

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: Never, bunch of hoo-ey if you ask me. People see what they wanna see.

speaker: MULDER
line: But, if I wanted to talk to those UFO nuts, that you refered to earlier, where would I go?

speaker: ZOE
line: F-15 Eagle pulling about four g's. Those boys think they are such hotshots. Get a few drinks in `em, you'd think it was them up there flapping their wings.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who's the photographer?

speaker: ZOE
line: Various and sundry. I took the one on the end there.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're kidding, where?

speaker: ZOE
line: Out on the back porch, taking out the garbage, and there it was, just hovering. Quiet like a hummingbird. For a minute there, I thought it was gonna land in the parking lot and I was gonna have to serve `em lunch. I'm selling limited edition prints, twenty dollars. Down to my last five, if you're interested.

speaker: MULDER
line: Put it on my tab.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sucker.

speaker: MULDER
line: What would the chances be, of someone like me, seeing a UFO?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Catch ye outside.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wanna see something weird, Mulder? Ellens Air Base isn't even on my US GS quadrant map.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know. Let's go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know. Where are we going?

speaker: MULDER
line: We got our own map, sucker.

speaker: WARNING
line: THIS AREA IS A RESTRICTED MILITARY INSTALLATION TO THE WEST. At the top of the sign is a symbol indicating no cameras. Mulder stops the car further up the road beside a fence. He gets out goes to the boot and gets a pair of binoculars)

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you honestly hope to see?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, maybe nothing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is this why we came out here, Mulder? To look for UFOs. Yea, this is gonna look real good on my field report.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Aaaaaah!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, wake up. You've gotta see this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Unnh!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are they?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, just keep watching it's unbelievable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's unreal. I've never seen anything like it.

speaker: MULDER
line: They've been going at it like that for almost half an hour.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it can't be aircraft. Aircraft can't manoeuvre like that.

speaker: MULDER
line: What else could they be?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, lasers maybe. Being shot from the ground, reflecting up off the clouds. Oh my God.

speaker: MULDER
line: Here comes another one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not a plane, that's a helicopter.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey.

speaker: EMIL
line: Let's get outta here. Ok, don't shoot.

speaker: MULDER
line: Stay right there.

speaker: LADONNA
line: We didn't do anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on.

speaker: EMIL
line: Heh, heh, That was extreme.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's go, you're coming with us.

speaker: EMIL
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, what exactly were you guys doing in there?

speaker: EMIL
line: We were, erm, we're...

speaker: LADONNA
line: We kinda have this spot.

speaker: EMIL
line: You know, we go, we kinda, kick back and listen to some tunes and, er, watch the air show.

speaker: MULDER
line: Were you ever chased out before?

speaker: EMIL
line: No, first time right. Our friend showed us a hole in the fence about a year ago.

speaker: LADONNA
line: Oh, one time they dropped these bombs, wooah!

speaker: EMIL
line: Yeah, it was kinda heavy. Oh, ar, there's this place, ar, called the Yellow Base, right, where they're supposed to store all this stuff. And my friend said that, there's landmines all around it and junk like that.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: I've got a twenty, over.

speaker: WALKIE-TALKIE
line: Roger, Redbird, assume fall back position, we're opening the gate.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: Redbird out.

speaker: EMIL
line: Sometimes they come in real low, and just put on the scares right, it's like eeoou-ra and then they just hang there, and hover without making a sound. And you just think, you know, who turned down the volume right.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you think they are?

speaker: EMIL
line: Ok, everybody thinks that they're like UFOs, but I think it's some kinda, star wars cyber- tech new fangled hardware right, they probably roll it out for, desert storm II or something like that. Cruise right over Saddam's house, you know, it'll be like, what.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do they look anything like this?

speaker: EMIL
line: No, they look exactly like that.

speaker: EMIL
line: Thanks.

speaker: MULDER
line: Later Dude!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Evidence. Kids today, huh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You believe it all, don't you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why wouldn't I?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, did you see their eyes? If I were that stoned I...

speaker: MULDER
line: Ho-hoo. If you were that stoned, what.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you could have shown that kid a picture of a flying hamburger and he would have told you that's exactly what he saw.

speaker: MULDER
line: Alright, I wanna show you something. This is a photo, of a UFO that reportedly crashed in Roswell, New Mexico in 1947. Now I know, you don't believe that story but just hear me out. Now, Ellens Air Base, the same base that we're at right now, the same base, that for some strange reason, doesn't appear on your US government map, is supposedly, one of the six sites where parts from the wreckage were shipped.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, are you suggesting that the military is flying UFOs.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, planes built, using UFO technology.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, c'mon. You've got two blurry photos, one of them taken almost fifty years ago, and another one, you purchased today in a roadside diner. You're going out on a pretty big limb.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell me, there isn't a remarkable resemblance.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tell me, one good reason why either of these photos is authentic.

speaker: MULDER
line: You saw exactly what I saw in the sky tonight. What do you think they were?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just because I can't explain it, doesn't mean I'm gonna believe they were UFOs.

speaker: MULDER
line: Unidentified Flying Objects, I think that fits the description pretty well. Tell me I'm crazy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you're crazy. And it still doesn't explain to me, what happened to Colonel Budahas.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thanks.

speaker: WOMAN
line: You're welcome.

speaker: MULDER
line: You didn't come to raid my mini-bar, did ye?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You ready for this.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We got a message from Mrs. Budahas, her husband came home last night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We got your message.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Budahas, are you ok?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: C,come inside.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: What? What's wrong?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: That, is not my husband.

speaker: LT. COLONEL ROBERT BUDAHAS
line: Honey, who are these people?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: That is not him. That is not my husband. They've done something to him.

speaker: LT. COLONEL ROBERT BUDAHAS
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's ok, it's ok, just relax, wel, I'm Special Agent Mulder, from the FBI. We're out here investigating your disappearance Colonel Budahas. Wondering if you have any explanation of your whereabouts over the past four months.

speaker: LT. COLONEL ROBERT BUDAHAS
line: I was in the hospital.

speaker: MULDER
line: Here, on base?

speaker: LT. COLONEL ROBERT BUDAHAS
line: I think so.

speaker: MULDER
line: Colonel Budahas, do you mind if I ask you your birthdate?

speaker: LT. COLONEL ROBERT BUDAHAS
line: November 21st, 1948.

speaker: MULDER
line: And the names of your kids?

speaker: LT. COLONEL ROBERT BUDAHAS
line: Josh and Lesley, they're right there.

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Green Bay fan.

speaker: LT. COLONEL ROBERT BUDAHAS
line: Yes sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: Bet you remember the Superbowl of 68, huh? Don Shandler.

speaker: LT. COLONEL ROBERT BUDAHAS
line: Kicked four field goals, Lombardy's last game. Why do I have to answer these questions?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: It's not him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Colonel, Colonel Budahas, you're a, a pilot, isn't that right?

speaker: LT. COLONEL ROBERT BUDAHAS
line: Yes sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: Bet you've flown just about everything with two wings. I got this hotshot pilot friend, who said that he could do Immelmann at a sustained eight g's, huh, is that possible?

speaker: LT. COLONEL ROBERT BUDAHAS
line: I, I don't... I can't... Anita, I can't remember.

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, would you explain to me what's going on.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think they re-wired that man's brain. Some kind of selective memory drain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The brain doesn't work like that, Mulder. You can't just go in and erase certain files.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then you explain it to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There are types of amnesia th..

speaker: MULDER
line: This is not amnesia, I think it's something far more deliberate and insidious.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All I'm saying, is that the science or medical technology to do what you are suggesting, does not exist.

speaker: MULDER
line: And neither does the technology to fly the aircraft we saw last night. Listen to me Scully, they can do this. That man, he should have known the answer to the question, it just wasn't in his head anymore.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Even if they could, why would they do such a thing?

speaker: MULDER
line: To control information. I think that after his psychotic episode, Colonel Budahas became a security risk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It couldn't just be that he had a nervous breakdown with a concomitant memory lapse?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I think that men like Colonel Budahas are physiologically incapable of dealing with the stress of flying the aircraft we saw. Or doing those manoeuvres, at those speeds. I mean we're talking about a technology that is so sensitive and advanced, that it's taken almost fifty years to make it work. UFO technology, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the hell is th..

speaker: MULDER
line: Hold on.

speaker: MAN
line: Please, step out of the car.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think if maybe we ignore him, he'll go away?

speaker: MAN
line: Please, step out of the car.

speaker: MULDER
line: Guess not. Special Agent Mulder, FBI.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Federal Agents.

speaker: MULDER
line: You wanna tell me what this is about.

speaker: MAN
line: National security. Now get in your car. You'll be escorted back to your motel. You will pack and leave town immediately, or assume the consequences of intense indiscretion.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing under Idaho plate CC1356, no plate registered under that number. Thanks Gayle, no no no, I'm sure the other one's bogus too, bye. So who were those guys?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think it was those kids they were chasing away from the base last night, I think it was us. They knew we were coming before we ever arrived. And they returned Colonel Budahas as a decoy. There's something I didn't tell you, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Something else.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was approached by a man in D.C. who warned me to stay away from this case, he didn't give me his name, and my phone was being tapped.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What!

speaker: MULDER
line: Why would they go to all this trouble? Out of a need for security. Security of what? I think there's a huge conspiracy here Scully. They've got a UFO here, I'm sure of it. And they'll do anything to keep it a secret, including sacrificing lives and minds of those pilots, because what if that secret got out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If, if that were true, it would be a national scandal.

speaker: MULDER
line: No no, you're not thinking big enough, if it were true, it would be confirmation of the existence of extra terrestrial life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you ever stop to think that what we saw was simply an experimental plane. Like the stealth bomber or, this Aurora Project. Doesn't the government have a right and a responsibility, to protect it's secrets?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, but at what cost, when does the human cost become too high for the building of a better machine?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, these are questions we have no business asking. Our kidnap victim is no longer outstanding. Let's get out of here Mulder, while you still have a job.

speaker: MULDER
line: Aren't you even curious? Aaerm, I gonna shower, I'll pack and then, we'll get outta here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, where are you going?

speaker: EMIL
line: Right here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, aren't you guys coming?

speaker: EMIL
line: No, we're, you know, we've only gone in at night.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ok, this spot you told me about where you watch the air show, how far is it?

speaker: EMIL
line: Fourty-five minutes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Will I be able to find it?

speaker: LADONNA
line: Just stay on the path.

speaker: MULDER
line: And what about this other place you told me about, Yellow Base, where they hangar them.

speaker: EMIL
line: Don't, don't even, it's like ten miles, nobody's ever, nobody's ever been that far.

speaker: LADONNA
line: Hey, don't go past the edge of the tall weeds.

speaker: EMIL
line: Oh man, did we tell him about the, landmines and junk? HEY!

speaker: VOICE
line: Go, go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nooo.

speaker: VOICE
line: C'mon. Hold `im. Oxygen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I'm, I'm trying to make a call to Washington D.C. an, and I can't seem to get a long distance line. Hello? Hello? Excuse me. Erm, my phone's not working, can I use yours to make a credit card call, please?

speaker: MOTEL MANAGER
line: Sure thing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This one's not working either.

speaker: MOTEL MANAGER
line: Phones are pretty undependable around here. People say it's the military interference, but, they say that about everything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thanks.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: Hi, I was just looking for you. I knocked, but I saw the door was open.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was in the lobby trying to make a call.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: Phones down again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: WALKIE-TALKIE
line: Base to redbird, can you give us your position, over? Redbird do you copy?

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: What are you doing? Excuse me. There's nothing in there. smashes the passenger's window with a fire extinguisher and Scully drops the gun while covering herself from the glass. Paul reaches in for Scully but she manages to push her thumb in his eye. He then goes around to the driver's door but Scully gets out and holds the gun to his face)

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get on the car. Hands on the car, do it.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: Put the gun down, and we'll talk about it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I said, hands against the car. Who are you?

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: You're a long way from home, Dr. Scully. Nobody wants this to come to violence now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's Mulder?

speaker: EMIL
line: We took `im to the base.

speaker: LADONNA
line: We waited for `im.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want you to get on that walkie-talkie and find out where Mulder is.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: I don't think I can do that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you can, or I'm gonna have every newspaper in America out here, writing about your experimental aircraft.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: There are other ways to go about this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I've already seen where you get with tears and a sad story.

speaker: WALKIE-TALKIE
line: Your target is arriving 12.

speaker: GUARD
line: Roger.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are we doing?

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: Waiting.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want the car running. I said start the car. And put your hands on the wheel, where I can see them.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: You do anything stupid, and this situation could get big in a hurry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, you just keep telling yourself that.

speaker: WALKIE-TALKIE
line: Intruder arriving.

speaker: GUARD
line: Copy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want you to keep the car running, and step out of the car. Get in the car Mulder. Get in the car.

speaker: PAUL MOSSINGER
line: I just wanna say, everything you've seen here is equal to the protection we give it. It's you who have acted inappropriately.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You ok Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think so. Scully I...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: How did I get here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi.

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Hello.

speaker: MULDER
line: We came by to see how your husband was doing.

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Oooh, he's fine, he's getting much better now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you think, maybe, we could see him.

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Aaerm, wel, well he's resting now.

speaker: LT COLONEL ROBERT BUDAHAS
line: Who is it now?

speaker: ANITA BUDAHAS
line: Thank you for your concern.

speaker: MULDER
line: They got to her Scully. They were here, they must have threatened her and Budahas..

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's enough Mulder. We don't know anything. Anything more than when we got here, and that's what I gonna write in my field report. Let's get outta here Mulder, as fast as we can.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Your lives, may be in danger.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Mmm, you've seen things that weren't to be seen. Care and discretion, are now imperative.

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw something I...

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: As I said, I can provide you with information, but only so long as it's in my best interest to do so.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is your interest?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: The truth.

speaker: MULDER
line: I did see something, but it's gone, they took it from me, they erased it. You have to tell me what it was.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: A military UFO? Mr. Mulder, why are those like yourself, who believe in the existence of extra terrestrial life on this earth, not dissuaded by all the evidence to the contrary?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because, all the evidence to the contrary, is not entirely dissuasive.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Precisely.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're here, aren't they?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Mr. Mulder, they've been here for a long long time.
